website_summaries.verdict: The first good redesign of an old classic tool, this all-metal post hole digger is a joy to use.
pros: This design keeps you from banging your knuckles together as so often happens with other post hole diggers
It creates an evenly sized hole all the way down, and the weight  helps it bite into the soil
cons: This post hole digger weighs twice as much as the wooden handled diggers, so it requires some upper body strength to use it all day

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: This is a pound and twist post hole digger, so not much of an improvement over the regular post hole diggers for me. We needed to dig post holes next to an existing fence and thought this would make it easy, but we discovered that our T-handled digger (purchased a looooong time ago and still available on amazon) will accept a gas pipe rod as an extension to the handle which allowed us to just twist our way down into the ground (no pounding). I suppose that this is better than a standard post hole digger, but it's just not for me.
customer_reviews.author: K Griffee

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: The strength and quality of this tool greatly surpassed my expectations. I have always been pleased and impressed by Fiskar tools, and this is just another fine example of their superior products. I was able to use this more quickly and efficiently than I had expected, and the job that I needed to complete was done in no time. The weight of the tool adds to the breaking of the soil, and the blades are strong and thin to slice through and create a very nice hole. The design makes taking the soil out of the hole easy and effortless.
customer_reviews.author: jaemin33

customer_reviews.title: Great digger, but heavy!
customer_reviews.text: There's a lot to like about this tool. The length of the tool makes it possible to dig deeper than most store-bought diggers, making your job one step better than your neighbor's. This results in better post setting and saves rework time. Also, since it uses an inverted hinge, the top part of the hole doesn't flare as much as traditional post hole diggers. The all-steel construction means this beast will last a lifetime too. The only downside is the tool's weight. Before taking on a workday with this tool, make sure to warm up your upper body, as this thing can wear you out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The nicest hole digger I've used - but a bit heavy
customer_reviews.text: I had to dig a few post holes for a fence/gate on my property, and didn't have a good post hole digger. I bought this and immediately put it to use, and was impressed with how quickly it worked. The soil I was digging was red Carolina clay, and this tool got through it very quickly. My only negative comment is about the weight - it's quite a shoulder workout to use this, especially with heavy clay. But I'm happy to put up with a bit more weight, if it means that the tool is more durable.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Carter

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and heavy but they don't pull enough dirt
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because of the ergonomic design, which is great. The problem is, they are heavier than some of the other ones and the tips don't even come close to touching when closed, so everything that is smaller than the opening falls right back into the hole! You end up doing three times the work. The two shovels should be almost touching when closed so you actually can remove the soil!
customer_reviews.author: Scott Z

customer_reviews.title: dig deep hole without top of hole being huge
customer_reviews.text: can dig 3 feet deep and top of hole will stay around 9 inches in diameter, great if lots of roots or want to limit damage like typical post hole digger where at 3 feet deep top of hole is close to 18 inches wide. CON- the pivot point is rather weak and very prone to wear, it will work and last for doing a fence in urban back yard but dont pound really hard into hole, use metal break up rod. certainly not a commercial grade product a contractor can use for years!
customer_reviews.author: Robin L.

customer_reviews.title: Built tough
customer_reviews.text: Strong but the only worry I have is the gap at the bottom when you "close" the mechanism. it's a few inches which leaves some room for dirt to fall. I just wish it would've closed a bit more - even though there is little dirt actually falling out when in use.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Well made and worked well for 30 inch post holes Wait - IT BENT!!
customer_reviews.text: I thought it would be heavy but it worked fine I am a 62 year old man - in other words not a young guy. I used a gas post hole digger to start with and this to clean out and bottom the holes. About the 4th hole I noticed the handles were not aligned and by the 6th one was noticeably bent. I am now in the process of bending them back after every hole. I have a clay soil - but as I said the holes were pre-dug. Shame, I liked it at first. And of course it can not be sent back - a whole two months old!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Rocks

customer_reviews.title: Great for deep digging
customer_reviews.text: Used this tool to dig post holes for my fence. I needed to dig much deeper than is typical because I was setting some aluminum posts inside my vinyl fence posts.. these go in to increase strength on the gate posts and corner posts. These are long enough and heavy duty enough to get down there plus since they crossover instead of open like regular post hole diggers you can close them at a much greater depth without having to widen the hole at the top. A life saver.. they are heavier than your average digger but very sturdy. No problems .. so far 1 job.. 18 post holes.. works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Cbrew

customer_reviews.title: Good while it lasted (less than 1 hole)
customer_reviews.text: Well, I really wanted to like this tool, but it bent pretty severely halfway through the one and only hole I attempted to dig. Paint chipped off the bent portion and the underlying metal looked pretty severely rusted. Bad quality control. I’ve never had this problem with a more traditional post hole digger. Sorry to say this one is going back and getting something with hardwood handles.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Downs

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: Excellent tool, made of steel. I needed something to reach down to clean a dry well that has a 12" top opening. This tool is perfect and the only thing I could find to work. Other pole diggers cannot open wide enough to (with my 12" opening). Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: 922Vision

customer_reviews.title: Best value for the money
customer_reviews.text: I love Fiskars tools. They have a GREAT No BS warranty and very good quality from their axes to this post hole digger. My petite wife even did very well with it in digging (2) 42" holes for me. I have a very bad back but I managed to dig 2 holes with breaks in between as well.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Good Idea - Bad Execution
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to dig about 10 fence posts. This is what it looked like after the third one. The funny part is how the "lifetime warranty" badge on the side is bent like a rope. Returned...
customer_reviews.author: Ray D - Pittsburgh

customer_reviews.title: Dont let the design fool you, this is a really good posthole digger!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to replace an old typical type. I was a little skeptical of the design. That said, we used it with great success to put in fence posts (30 ish). It is very sturdy (and slightly heavy, especially after many holes). The weight helped us because it pushed down into the dirt with ease though. Also was able to handle chipping off concrete overflow along side a concrete pad with no problems. The scissor type action makes it so you don't have to spread the bars so wide before removing dirt - that is a good feature. All said, no complaints and fairly impressed by this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Coleman

customer_reviews.title: Lighter than I thought
customer_reviews.text: This steel handle is lighter than I thought. I recall using a solid wood handle in the past and imagine this product is lighter than that. Constantly lifting this product out of the ground wasn't a huge factor on my shoulders/arms. The shape of the blade was helpful in 'slicing' through the dirt. Also, when using the tool in a prying motion, the 'depth' of the blade was sturdy enough you're not worried about any yielding of the steel.
customer_reviews.author: Dave C

customer_reviews.title: It is nice to own a tool and know it is the ...
customer_reviews.text: These are getting very hard to find. All-steel construction, Lifetime Warranty. The only way these could have been improved would have been if they were made of stainless steel but that wouldn't be cost efficient. For a $50+/- tool, they are well worth the investment. Finding tools still made of steel is hard to do in this day of fiberglass, wood, and composite fabrication. It is nice to own a tool and know it is the only one you will ever need to buy. A dual bend in the design may have offered more stability though as too much pressure can still bend the handles fairly easily since they are straight. .
customer_reviews.author: S. Coley

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre
customer_reviews.text: This product is just okay. I bent the handle after only digging two holes. By the end of the day and digging a total of fourteen holes, the handle completely broke off. I actually had to dig the last hole with a shovel. After contacting the manufacturer, I was sent a replacement. I have not used the new one yet. It may be okay for very lite use, but does not hold up for heavy use.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Light and Efficient
customer_reviews.text: That seems to be the theme of Fiskars design & that's why I love their products. I read all the reviews and decided not to settle for the traditional heavy post-hole digger I could buy for a few dollars less at the local big-box store. I had to order the Fiskars 9653 Post Hole Digger and wait a few days, but I am completely satisfied. Remember to listen to the "old timers" when they tell you to do your digging with a long metal bar and use your Post Hole Digger just to remove the loose material. If you do that, it will outlast you, guaranteed.
customer_reviews.author: Wes

customer_reviews.title: Digging like a Champ
customer_reviews.text: I have been building a VERY long fence in my backyard and this posthole digger has far surpassed my expectations for digging all the holes... It is strong and durable which means it went through roots easily.. Also, being so strong it went through a drain pipe very easily ;( Just be sure you know where you are digging before using this because it will go down deep very quickly :)
customer_reviews.author: Marshall

customer_reviews.title: It's heavy but not heavy duty!
customer_reviews.text: Dug 1 (one) hole and the handles bent 3x's. Was able to back by hand, feels heavy and strong but the steal is too weak. Maybe ok for light duty and soft soils but not hardpack.
customer_reviews.author: SQUIRREL! Sorry, what was I saying?

customer_reviews.title: Excelente to dig 3 feet deep holes
customer_reviews.text: I just got this tool about a week ago I had been digging about 25 post holes about 3 feet deep without any problem it took me only 1 day to dig all those whole. If you have a farm you need to have this tool. Obviously you will need to be in good health condition because to dig deeper you need to bend down. This tool is very very strong and I am sure it will last a long time
customer_reviews.author: jose

customer_reviews.title: A well-made and effective tool
customer_reviews.text: Nice tool, well made and sturdy. Busts through soil and small roots. Can wear you out at the start as it is a bit tall and causes you to stretch when beginning the hole, but that height is really useful as the depth of the hole progresses. I use it regularly when planting groups of daffodil bulbs, making planting holes for annuals, and making planting spots for perennials and shrubs. Just as useful as my planting spade. Extracts a good-sized soil clump and clears it out easily.
customer_reviews.author: D. W. Lunt

customer_reviews.title: Best Post Hole Digger Ever
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and easy to use. Will dig a deeper hole in less time than a conventional digger. This will make a slightly larger diameter hole than a conventional digger, so you will need a bit more concrete for fill. It's almost impossible to bang your knuckles together when using this. The all-steel construction is very sturdy, I expect this to last for years. Wood or fiberglass handles usually break or separate from the digging head after only a few uses. The only drawback is the signature orange handles slip off when lifting a load of soil. I recommend gluing them on.
customer_reviews.author: D. Berg

customer_reviews.title: odd design, very functional
customer_reviews.text: looked like a novelty idea but they work great. so far, i set 8 fence posts 36 inches deep with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: Replacement PostHole Digger Operated As Advertised
customer_reviews.text: The replacement Fiskars PostHole Diggers worked as advertised. Great tool for digging plat/shrub holes - efficient and easily managed. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: cadet

customer_reviews.title: They have good weight to them and a nice cutting area but ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband used it for digging 8 2ft deep holes and the bars bent. Not sure they are made quite strong enough. They have good weight to them and a nice cutting area but the bars are hollow and are not very rigid. He was able to bend the bars back into shape so we could finish the job at least. Guess I expected more after reading the reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Witucke

customer_reviews.title: Do you need some deep holes?
customer_reviews.text: This is amazing.. the way this is designed you can really dig a deep hole.. we needed to dig down 38”. Very sturdy product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sorry quality for a Fiskar product.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these 6 years ago and they have been VERY lightly used and kept inside. They broke. I'm a believer in Fiskar products. Not this time. I'll now see if they stand behind they're lifetime warranty.
customer_reviews.author: jeff novak

customer_reviews.title: BUY THIS
customer_reviews.text: This is simply a better design than traditional post hole diggers. Offset handles prevents crunching ones knuckles. Geometry of design readily allows 48” deep holes with roughly 10” diameter. First weekend I owned them, I used them for over 10 hours. Not once did I complain about the tool. After digging a few dozen holes, I will never again use the classic version of this tool.
customer_reviews.author: charles

customer_reviews.title: Spectacular Design
customer_reviews.text: this is an exceptional device, I thought people were just blowing smoke but, I have to say it dose the job well above your normal hole digger. Felt super effortless and I you don't have to put in the push muscle that your normal hole digger needs. Fantastic pick up design.
customer_reviews.author: Ernesto L Torna

customer_reviews.title: I have used this thing to build a shed, ...
customer_reviews.text: I have used this thing to build a shed, with 6 posts, used it to put up a fence with about 8 posts total. It doesn't pick up a lot of dirt each time, but I was able to work with it and it is really tough, will cut through roots...I have had this for a couple years now.
customer_reviews.author: Brian F.

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk!!
customer_reviews.text: I would rate this product zero stars if it was possible. I was digging my second hole when i bent one of the handles near the hinge. I had seen other reviews suggesting that this was an issue, but had hoped that those were accounts of people misusing the digger. I was shocked at how little force it took to ruin it. Complete waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: ctrain45cn

customer_reviews.title: Fiskars digger--
customer_reviews.text: Excuse the pun---"I REALLY DIG THIS TOOL"!!! All the "cons" posted about the weight, are "pros"--for the most part, you simply drop the digger well above the hole to be dug and drop it! Due to the hefty weight (which I feel is a plus)it will penetrate about 1/2 the length of the blades in normal soil, other soil conditions might require you to exert s bit of downward force. Another plus over the standard type is no knuckle busting or broken shafts. This tool will last forever, well worth the money, neighbors are sure to borrow this!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jack in NJ

customer_reviews.title: Much better than the other style I'm used to.
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what it's supposed to - dig holes! Much better than any other clam shovel I've tried; goes right through dirt like a knife through butter and actually /holds/ the dirt better so you can pull it out. The plastic-like grip also kept my hands from slipping as much as I'm used to. Like any post hole digger though; you still definitely need a digging bar to accompany this - it's not going to cut through roots, rock, and harder clay soils on its own.
customer_reviews.author: Fenrah

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This was a present for my husband and he’s a FAN! When the city inspector looked at 1 hole he asked if the other 11 were like the one he was seeing. My husband replied yes and the permit was handed him to continue the project.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra JK

customer_reviews.title: Better than a power auger
customer_reviews.text: Rented a gas powered auger but it didn't work good with my soil (lots of potato sized rocks). This thing was faster and less work. Fiskars does a nice job improving the standard outdoor maintenance tools. The design of the handles lets you dig deeper and smaller diameter holes.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: The design of these posthole diggers can't be beat. My son started building fence when he was 14. He is now 31. We bought a pair of these diggers over 10 years ago and he is still using them. He has used them in every type of soil you can think of, ranging from hard pan clay to sugar sand and wouldn't trade them. Got him the new digger so he can have an extra. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Wanda Doty

customer_reviews.title: BEST SET I HAVE EVER OWNED
customer_reviews.text: I have farmed for years, and over those years I have used a dozen different post hole diggers of several different designs. The are by far the best. They cut through dirt, and roots with equal ease. They are tough, light, and dig like crazy. The handle designs allows for deeper easier digging. I have PTO driven post hole digger for my John Deere and if I dont have anymore than 10 or 15 holes to dig I don't even bother hooking it up.
customer_reviews.author: farmhand

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: These are great and built Amaizing. Had a set for the better part of 20 years and they broke. Definitely got the moneys worth out of them. Highly recommend them for anyone doing work that requires post hole diggers.
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: If I can dig it, you can dig it!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a digging fool! Need to dig a 4 foot hole, no problem. It is a bit heavier than the standard wooden digger and its a bit stiff to open and close. I learned to open it at a little differently and the heavier weight helps cut through Texas gumbo (black clay).
customer_reviews.author: TexicanTop Contributor: Golf

customer_reviews.title: Great design. Very well made. Will last for a long time
customer_reviews.text: Got these on time. Great design bc u can go deeper than regular post hole diggers. Heavy steel construction helps to drive deeper in dirt and cut thru roots. Husband really liked them better than the wooden ones he had.
customer_reviews.author: tess devin

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Dig holes easily with this. Really like the scissor design. Takes out a lot of dirt.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecka Pearson

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, light weight and really good at digging holes. It's a little tricky pulling up very sandy soil, but otherwise it works great. I use it with an earth drill to finish the drilled holes and to dig holes that the earth drill can't.
customer_reviews.author: bpjammin

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding product
customer_reviews.text: This post hole digger is by far the best I have ever used. It's cuts right through tree roots and Rocky ground is not a problem anymore for me I'm extremely impressed I just wish I had this post hole digger years ago
customer_reviews.author: jam2x

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: This thing is built strong. That's the good side. The negative side, if there is one, is all that strength is achieved by using heavy materials. This thing will test your muscles because of its weight. In my case, being a 59 year old middle manager, I nearly failed the test. You can go lighter, but this thing does a great job ann you don't feel like it's going to bend or break under you.
customer_reviews.author: ggruner

customer_reviews.title: The ergonomics is nice, but the steel is cheap
customer_reviews.text: The ergonomics is nice, but the steel is cheap. It bent on my first use. Just be warned, go easy on them. Not sure if any other types would have been any better, so if you don't plan on going hard, I would still consider these.
customer_reviews.author: exlibris

customer_reviews.title: Tough Heavy Duty Post Hole Digger
customer_reviews.text: The handle design is great. The opening and closing action was a bit stiff. They are on the heavier side but for a mostly metal tool they are built stout and should last for a quite a few years. They worked well on my job and made it easy to dig a 3' fence post hole.

customer_reviews.title: This tool is great value for money
customer_reviews.text: This tool is great value for money. It is possible to bend it if you are trying to do too much with it. The extra length is great, especially if you're digging 30 inch post holes like I was. I recommend getting 60 inch slate bar as well. I used that to break up any clay that got in the way.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Spittell

customer_reviews.title: they work differently
customer_reviews.text: the handles don't need to open as far as regular diggers and the space saves your knuckles and actually dig faster
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: Ideal design, although construction integrity not as robust I hoped for.
customer_reviews.text: This looks like a good design, placing the leverage point higher than conventional post hole diggers. However the tubes are not composed of thick-wall steel. My digger bent upon first use and required rebending steel tubes to complete job. I am not sure if diggers, like this model, are constructed to be lighter weight for less strong people. This is the only reason I could conclude other than cost savings in materials, but it does not bode well for the product design and ultimately the Fiskars brand. I would be more cautious of buying Fiskars in the future, unless I was swayed they are not taking the low-road approach to material integrity in their products.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Sean Borja

customer_reviews.title: Great design
customer_reviews.text: Best pair of jobbers I ever used. I had a pair of the slide-handle type and a pair of the spread-handle type, but these work far better - no pinched fingers!! Also the spread design allows digging a pretty deep hole without enlarging the diamater. They are a bit heavier than my old ones, but I was building 40 rods of fence where we dozed out a tree line, and had plenty of tree roots to cut, so I was not unhappy with the extra weight and cutting force. Glad I bought them.
customer_reviews.author: Safari

customer_reviews.title: One of the best if not the best
customer_reviews.text: I mean it when I say it One of the best if not the best I think it is the best easy to use I repair mailboxes for the town and I have used quite a few post whole diggers and this is the best I have ever used it is all steel made in the usa only one pivot point. I'm telling you it may look awkward but it isn't if you want an easy way to hand dig a hole this is it look no further.
customer_reviews.author: Ronj

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: The digger basket doesn’t close as closely as other hole diggers, but this rarely causes a loss issue. I have made more progress with this posthole digger in less time than I made with a gas powered auger.
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: Great for hard soil.
customer_reviews.text: I have caliche soil and it is a bugger to dig through. This tool really did a nice job. I was able to wet the dirt and pound my way through. The digger didn't scratch, bend or dent. When I could get some dirt, it was easy to remove and didn't drop half of it back into the hole like a shovel would. I would recommend it for all jobs.
customer_reviews.author: nwilkaz

customer_reviews.title: Good one!
customer_reviews.text: Hard, firm, and easy to grab dirt but not so sharp to dig dry surface.
customer_reviews.author: Yaksha Dahal

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: Does a good job of digging a hole quickly for setting posts. Only problem is the ends don't close like others have mentioned so sometimes you pull it up and all the dirt falls through if its loose. It's a small issue that doesn't effect the usefulness very much. Feels very sturdy & well built.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: A beast!
customer_reviews.text: I break everything that’s not made well and this thing is a beast. Digging through riverbed rock and even gravel...which I wouldn’t advise. I’ve dug 13 2” holes with relative ease.
customer_reviews.author: Erick

customer_reviews.title: First glance this looked like a great product
customer_reviews.text: First glance this looked like a great product. Looked sturdy and well put together. However, first time I used it one of the arms bent and it's no longer usable. Didn't torque on it too much either. Take a look at the picture, does this look like a solid product to you?? Avoid. Now I have to go through the warranty process...
customer_reviews.author: jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Super!
customer_reviews.text: I've never used post hole diggers before. But I'm certainly glad that these are the one and only that I have used. In clay soils, usually hard when dry, were no match for this post hole digger. I feel as though a dug three 20 inch deep holes quite quickly. But I didn't time it.
customer_reviews.author: R Walt

customer_reviews.title: A must own yard tool.
customer_reviews.text: Best pothole diggers I've ever owned. This this is made to last. Unlike the diggers with wooden handles, these steel handles won't be breaking or loosening anytime soon. Good weight so they do some of the driving themselves. The handles are designed so they will dig deeper than traditional pothole diggers while still fully closing when you start getting deep.
customer_reviews.author: MLJ

customer_reviews.title: works as expected
customer_reviews.text: the "scissor" style digger is ideal for deeper holes but this one removes dirt quickly from shallow holes as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry A.

customer_reviews.title: Well Build
customer_reviews.text: Nicely built. Sharp and keeps its edges despite hitting a lot of rocks.
customer_reviews.author: TMF

customer_reviews.title: Good Posthole Digger
customer_reviews.text: Used to dig a 4 foot hole. It seemed sturdy, the way it pivots allows for deeper holes than other Diggers. Also used to create a hole for a pipe under a sidewalk concrete slab - it got a little scraped but it helped do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Henry

customer_reviews.title: what a great tool!
customer_reviews.text: One, this is an all metal tool. Great for the kind of ground I live on. Lots of rocks and it's tough to dig in. This tool is great for making short work in this kind of dirt. Being all metal, it won't break, chip or bend in the hole when it encounters a hard surface. Fiskars makes a great tool. Shipping got it here quick, unwrapped it and put it to use. This is a great tool. Well worth the extra price. Should last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: George Ross

customer_reviews.title: slim design
customer_reviews.text: Was so impressed! Great quality, nice design...worked amazing! Highly recommend! Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Jeannine Barnett

customer_reviews.title: Thing is junk
customer_reviews.text: Smart design junk materials.... keep bending the arms back and forth.
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: The best Hole Digger made!
customer_reviews.text: I've been replacing the privacy fence in our yard and have done almost 500 feet. I've dug all the holes by hand and this digger works great. I like the way it doesn't bell mouth the hole at the top like the old fashioned diggers. It will cut through small roots up to about 1/2" without a problem. Great product overall!
customer_reviews.author: JDF

customer_reviews.title: only way to dig a hole for a fence post
customer_reviews.text: this is the last post hole digger I will ever need, professional quality
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Heavy but nice. It's priced about the same as the other store brands. I love the Fiskars lifetime warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Jay G.

customer_reviews.title: Less effort
customer_reviews.text: We have hard clay soil with lots of roots. I had a regular post hole digger that was much harder to use, and cold not get bow frost line. It's much less effort using this.
customer_reviews.author: zscounter

customer_reviews.title: Great post hole digger. Worth the extra money.
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best post hole digger available. My first one dug 30 post holes thru rocks and tree roots before it failed. The pivot bearings came apart. Has a lifetime warranty so maybe I will send the first one in for a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: F. Pulka

customer_reviews.title: Very well made, makes easy work of digging posts
customer_reviews.text: Very well built. I dug 15 holes, 4 ft deep for a recent fence project. The handles are very heavy gauge tubing, the clamshells are very sharp to cut thru average size roots. And the design makes digging 4ft deep holes very easy. Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Absolute Best Posthole Diggers made in my opinion. Like all Fiskars products I have bought these are winners.
customer_reviews.text: An Absolute Beast of Post Hold Diggers. These will dig a deeper hole at least twice as fast as normal diggers. They are Heavy is the only drawback. Fiskars really outdid themselves on the design of these. They are built to last forever.
customer_reviews.author: S. Jennings

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: Worked really well, even on my heavy clay. Was able to dig a 3' hole in a short time. And I'm a 5'2", 73 year old woman.
customer_reviews.author: B. Hunt

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for planting shrubs and small trees
customer_reviews.text: This is great for planting shrubs and small trees. It leaves a neatly dug hole and makes planting much quicker. It's more comfortable too since you don't need to bend over.
customer_reviews.author: RPO

customer_reviews.title: So worth it
customer_reviews.text: I was worried that using this would take more strength that I had. I am a 59 year old woman. I had to install a mailbox. Piece of cake using this. It didn't really take any effort. It took me about 10 minutes to dig a 24 inch hole and barely broke a sweat. I have many things I'm going to use it for like planting trees and shrubs.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Powell

customer_reviews.title: Truly a MAJOR technological improvement on an age-old tool
customer_reviews.text: Makes you want to dig holes forever, changes the way you view digging post holes.
customer_reviews.author: Deliberately Omitted

customer_reviews.title: Needs help
customer_reviews.text: It takes a very strong person to separate the handles. Can’t be used
customer_reviews.author: keith smith

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the average homeowner
customer_reviews.text: Good quality for the price, if soil is harder the arms start to bend....
customer_reviews.author: Mike sopcak

customer_reviews.title: The best post hole digger you can buy....Period!
customer_reviews.text: This tool will get the job done FAST! No more banged knuckles, very accurate scissors action, digs a DEEP hole and is extremely high quality built. Don't even bother buying those other pieces of @%$^ at the local home stores! I'm only sorry that I didn't purchase this a lot sooner. I would rate it a "10" really.
customer_reviews.author: GreenHead

customer_reviews.title: Great design
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty, this is my second one only because someone stole my first which dug over 300 4ft 12 in pylons
customer_reviews.author: Jason S.

customer_reviews.title: Best I have used
customer_reviews.text: Excellent tool. the design makes it much easier to use than any other posthole digger. and the metal is tough. and the contraption is heavy enough that it really loosens hard soil and stones when you ram it into the hole.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Ice Cream

customer_reviews.title: Best post hole diggers i have ever used
customer_reviews.text: Best post hole diggers i have ever used. I could dig 3 ft holes without having to make the hole bigger like you would with the traditional style. Well made, should last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: RGS

customer_reviews.title: It's a good cardio and upper body workout
customer_reviews.text: This thing kicks arse. It's a good cardio and upper body workout, and makes deep holes fast. This tool made putting up steel fence posts downright easy.
customer_reviews.author: V&A M

customer_reviews.title: Way better than wooden handles
customer_reviews.text: This thing is built to last, and I like the separation of the handles. They could stand to be a bit more separated, but this design really reduces the chances of smashing your fingers when closing the handles together. This is easily the best post hole digger I have ever used. It is heavy, but that aids in driving it down into the hard soil.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fiskars anything is dope to have lasts forever and you can't break their axes either love fiskars.
customer_reviews.text: I try to break these and they won't break and work perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied!
customer_reviews.text: It's a five star review ! Heavy enough, sturdy and do the job!!! Use it for holes for my new fence.
customer_reviews.author: Valeri

customer_reviews.title: 👍
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding post hole digger. I dug through PA clay with no issue and it is sturdy enough to brake small stone and not be banged up. Great item.
customer_reviews.author: Davey

customer_reviews.title: Great present
customer_reviews.text: Son in law loved them. Was a Christmas present for him. I try not to use em anymore
customer_reviews.author: ROLL TIDE

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent post hole diggers,alittle heavy but will worth the extra money you pay.
customer_reviews.author: Dropman 23

customer_reviews.title: These are the best posthole diggers I have ever used
customer_reviews.text: I am a woman and approaching 60. These are the best posthole diggers I have ever used! So glad I ordered them. They dig through the ground with ease and small roots 1/2 inch to 1 inch in diameter are not problem for them! They are heavy enough to get the job done but not too heavy for me to handle comfortably.... I highly recommend these!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very effective but heavy
customer_reviews.text: I like this post hole digger lots...even though it's heavy. And I am an elderly woman.
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: you get a great workout in the process
customer_reviews.text: This is a real tool. Heavy for all the right reasons. Mass downward pressure digs into hard ground rather than just bounces off. If you have serious work to do get this tool. Secondary benefit, you get a great workout in the process. Excellent quality. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Richard D. Battle

customer_reviews.title: Best post hole digger I have ever used by a ...
customer_reviews.text: Best post hole digger I have ever used by a long shot. Sharp blades stay sharp. Very well engineered and manufactured product. Digs deep, digs accurately.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas W

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tool.
customer_reviews.text: This works really well. I've been able to easily dig 3ft deep tight holes for use with 4x4s. Very sturdily made.
customer_reviews.author: EricInDayton

customer_reviews.title: One of the best tools I ever bought
customer_reviews.text: One of the best tools I ever bought. Doing a lot of landscaping and I can plug a new plant faster than ever.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: great pair of post hole diggers
customer_reviews.text: great pair of post hole diggers. my wife thought a little heave but i had no problem using them.
customer_reviews.author: Grant

customer_reviews.title: No broken handles ever again!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use than one with straight wooden handles! It seemed to remove more dirt than others I've used.
customer_reviews.author: Trump is Your President

customer_reviews.title: Steel Posthole Digger
customer_reviews.text: Works well. I was surprised at how well they worked. The handles don't get in the way when you dig deep holes. Designed like they should be. Good quality construction.
customer_reviews.author: R.C.

customer_reviews.title: Great potential, but did not perform at all.
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. I would love to give these a great review, but cannot. I had 14 holes to dig for my fence and soil that was "normal". Just regular dirt, even soft loam. After the 3rd or 4th hole, I noticed these started to bend a little. Each dig saw one of the handle bend more and more. They were starting to bend right above the swivel point near the bottom. Before they bent, they worked great!!!! I was happy with them and they made digging holes almost fun, if that is possible!!!! I was so disappointed. If they did not bend so bad, I would give them 5 stars!!!! I hope they make these better in the future.
customer_reviews.author: HistoryOfTheYankeesDOTcom

product_meta.title: Fiskars 60 Inch Steel Posthole Digger
product_meta.description:
The Fiskars steel posthole digger makes it easy to dig extra deep postholes in tough soil. The welded steel construction is far more durable than wood and won’t flex like fiberglass, and it includes a welded steel pivot joint so there are no loose nuts or bolts. Sharpened blades cut into dense soil easily, and the offset handles let you dig postholes up to 12 inch deeper than traditional models while stopping your knuckles from smashing together as you dig.

AMAZON.COM
The Fiskars post hole digger features a unique handle profile that prevents you from banging your knuckles together when digging holes. The offset handles allow you to dig a full foot deeper than standard post hole diggers (up to 4-feet deep), while its all-steel construction lets you tackle the tough jobs. Pre-sharpened to cut through the ground easier, the unit's blades are welded directly to the shaft for additional strength, and the entire tool is powder-coated to prevent rust.
feature_bullets: Offset handles let you dig postholes up to 12 inch deeper than traditional models and protect your knuckles while you dig
Welded 14-gauge steel blades and 16-gauge steel shafts provide durability that far outlasts wood-handled tools and won’t flex like fiberglass
